intro: Elatostema adenophorum, commonly known as the glandular elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered with fine, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with showy, pinkish-white petals, typically blooming in the spring. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic research.
